page.title: 08TOURIST ATTRACTIONS: NEWLAND
page.content: {Newland church}is very big. A church has been on this site since 1200. By 1400 it had reached its present size with, at least, 12 priests carrying out their ministries from here in outlying districts. {Almshouses}to the south of the church were built in 1615, founded by{William {Jones}of the{Haberdasher's Company. {Canon Blade,}the warden,lives in the warden's house adjoining. Cottages on the north side of the churchyard used to be{Bell's Foundation}almshouses. Nearby, now a private house, is the 16th. century{Bell's School.} A 100 year old{cross}in the churchyard was probably a village assembly point, marking the point where 4 paths met. The{Newland Oak,}mentioned in the{ {Domesday Book,}died a few years ago and has been replaced by a young tree grown from one of its own acorns.
